content: A `DatePicker` combines a `DateInput` with a `Calendar` in a popover. It allows users to either type or visually select a date and time. It uses objects from the `@internationalized/date` package for values.
To allow users to select a time in addition to a date, provide a `CalendarDateTime` or `ZonedDateTime` object as the value and set the `granularity` to 'minute' or 'second'.
Key features include `isDisabled`, `isReadOnly`, `isRequired`, `minValue`, `maxValue`, `isDateUnavailable`, and `showMonthAndYearPickers` in the calendar popover.
DatePicker supports various `variants`, `colors`, `sizes`, and `labelPlacement` options. The calendar icon can be customized with the `selectorIcon` prop.
A DatePicker can be a controlled component. Use the `value` prop to set its value and the `onChange` event to handle changes.
Key stylable slots for DatePicker include `base`, `selectorButton`, `selectorIcon`, `popoverContent`, `calendar`, and `timeInput`.
DatePicker combines the accessibility features of both DateInput (segmented editing) and Calendar (keyboard navigation in the popover), providing a fully accessible experience for all users.
